column5: those of you who have taken grandchildren across the boarder, what has been your experience? I realize one needs documentation from parents which ideally should contain a phone and also be notarized. Have you had many problems with taking them to Canada or back to USA?

I have lots of grandson/grandpa trips to the camp. No major issues ever. You don't have to have the note notorized, however, it's a good idea. In the note, have the dates of your trip, location, and contact information for the parents. They also require a birth certificate or passport for the child.
It is also advisable to have included in the note, authority from the parents the right to make any immediate medical related decisions for a minor.
